page.title: 07March Fire Station
page.content: March is an{un-manned}station. There are 22 men who are{part-time}firemen. 5 or 6 of them are{on call}at one time.They must live and work within{2 {miles}of the station. Each man carries an{alerter}when he is on call.The{practice bleep}is long and slow,the{emergency bleep}is short and quick. At the end of the summer it is being replaced by a{computerised {system. There are{two engines}at March, one with a{two tone}siren,the other with the{American}siren.A{new engine}costs around Â£45,000.The fastest one goes at 75 mph and the engine is{automatic.}If {extra help}is needed{Wisbech}and {Peterborough}are alerted. The men{train}twice a week and attend some{weekend courses.}There is a{lecture room}at the station. Lesley Aley.
